headline: Simple Beef Stroganoff
description: This ground beef stroganoff recipe made with basic pantry items is rich and creamy, super simple to prepare, and ready to serve in under 30 minutes.

video.description: A quick and easy dinner recipe with beef and noodles in a creamy mushroom sauce.
video.name: Simple Beef Stroganoff

name: Simple Beef Stroganoff
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can fat-free condensed cream of mushroom soup
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Saut√© ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat until browned and crumbly; 5 to 10 minutes.
At the same time, fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rapid boil. Cook egg noodles at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, 7 to 9 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Drain and discard any fat from the cooked beef. Stir condensed soup and garlic powder into the beef. Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove beef from the heat. Add egg noodles and stir to combine. Stir in sour cream and season with salt and pepper.

review.reviewBody: Very good easy recipe added a little bit of water and used a little more sour cream and creM of mushroom also added half a tsp of onion powder

Bland and blase'. Did not enjoy this. Followed the recipe exactly. Very dry. Hamburger Helper tastes better than this. Hardly any flavor in this recipe. It needs something. Folks, you cannot give this recipe five stars if you changed it. All the five star reviewers changed the recipe. It's a lie that you made this if you tweaked it. I couldn't understand the five star reviews after I made this until I read them. I was totally misled into thinking this was going to be good based on the overall four star rating. Never again.
I followed the recipe exact, but mine came out very bland and mushy :(
I love this! Saute fresh mushrooms with the beef and use minced or fresh garlic (as opposed to powder), and you're good to go!!!

Very good. I added half a can of water to the soup/beef mixture and let simmer, made it saucier and coated the noodles better. Also added about half a cup of diced carrots and peas, I used frozen but defrosted them first, then added them along with the noodles and sour cream to the beef mixture.
Thank you! Quick and easy family enjoyed it ‚Ä¶..
This recipe is wonderful
Quick and easy! I thought 1 Tbsp garlic powder would be too much. It was perfect. Added 1/2 Tbsp onion powder as well and subbed Greek yogurt for sour cream.
Easy quick meal and tasty
I also made this receipe its delicious and so easy

Delicious, after some tweaking. Browned the meat and drained. Added 1 can cream of mushroom sauce, 1 can Golden Mushroom soup, 1 small can mushrooms, 1/3 cup sour cream, salt & pepper, garlic powder, paprika, splash Worcestershire sauce. Covered and simmered 5-10 min. Added cooked noodles. Yummy!
Added horse radish into the sour cream and then mixed it in at the end, great addition

A few tweaks and this is one of our family faves. Saut√©e some fresh mushrooms and onions first. Add a healthy splash of red wine! Makes a huge difference- delicious and still really easy. Sometimes I will do it with steak strips and sometimes ground beef.
It was delicious! I didn‚Äôt have noodles so I used elbow macaroni, and instead of fat free mushroom soup, I only had regular, but it turned out great! I will definitely make this again!
bland
I added saut√©ed onion and bell pepper and Worcestershire sauce for flavor and served over a bed of rice instead of adding noodles.
Love this recipe! Any time I feel like not cooking, I make this. Nearly no effort is required and it is so tasty and filling. Quicker than delivery.
Quick, easy, and tasted delicious. Perfect when you don't have much time but need to fill hungry bellies.
Not flavorful at all!

Simple and tasty. I read a couple other reviews and added some Worchestershire sauce and paprika. I will probably add some onion and fresh mushrooms next time too. But it's definitely a keeper, basic recipe that can be adjusted to your liking!

Like most other reviews I thought it was a nice starter recipe, though I didn't really add too much. I used two Ribeye steak , cut thin and seared , sauteed mushrooms , sliced onion and garlic , and used a beef paste bullion, and a cup of sour creme. Everybody loved it!
Bland.
The recipe was easy, fast, and delicious! Had it over noodles.

It was fast and easy to make! From long days at work, I want to make a home cooked meal fast to feed me and the kids. I added more sour cream to make it pop more in flavor and creaminess! I also add garlic salt with garlic powder equally. Roughly, one tablespoon a piece. It is one of the mes that even my pickiest teen will eat!
None, went as prescribed.
Substituted cream cheese for sour cream and added a 3/4 of a cup of beef broth. Also seasoned with hidden valley ranch seasoning packet!
Super easy and delicious! I added some mushrooms to it. So good!
Good recipe try saut√©ing onions in with your ground beef and add whole real mushrooms or sliced mushrooms with the cream and mushroom soup adds just that little more homemade feeling

Super easy to make and was delicious. I did forget to buy the sour cream but it was still great! Definitely will be adding it next time. A great choice for younger adults, like me, that don‚Äôt have much time to make dinner.
This turned out wonderful and it was really easy to prepare. your taste buds will thank you
I added a tablespoon of onion powder as well. Good!
Skip the soup and just saute some real mushrooms even canned mushrooms would be better than soup full of chemicals.
Wonderful little meal. Love the taste of it. I was out of sour cream, so substituted with Hidden Valley Ranch Seasoning instead and it was great!
It's fast & easy. Just make sure you get enough seasoning in it. YUM! YUM!üòã
Delicious and good

I added chopped mushrooms, diced onion to the 1# of ground turkey, plus a generous dash of paprika and garlic after the meat had browned. Added the can of mushroom soup and about 1/4 a can of water to get all the soup out of the can. Let the meat cook down, added the sour cream and 1/2 a packet of dry Ranch dressing. Put it over the noodles. Perfect. üòé

Made this last night using sirloin strips, I also put in mushrooms & onion..... The three other people besides myself were scarfing it down and saying how bomb it was!!! This simple recipe was better than all the more technical recipes. I will use this recipe for ever!!!

My family loved it. I did make a few modifications. I added some of the pasta water to the soup and beef mixture as I thought it was a little thick, a small can of mushroom pieces, diced fresh onion when I browned the ground beef and finished it with parsley.
I made a double batch right away & added fresh mushrooms! It is an easy, great tasting meal.
It was fine, but not as interesting as I expected. Though I didn‚Äôt have garlic powder so I used Camp Mix. Maybe that would have made a difference.

This turned out really good. I did make some changes though with reading the reviews. I added a half of a small white onion finely chopped and fried that with the ground beef. I added a full can of beef broth, 2 small glass jars of sliced mushrooms, a generous sprinkle of paprika, a tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce and 1 beef boullion cube. And instead of the garlic powder, I used a packet of ranch seasoning mix. I also used a 12 ounce bag of wide egg noodles. Absolutely delicious and quick to make. We will definitely be having this again!
I took notes from a few others, added paparika and beef bullion, a bit of water, next time will add beef broth and the ranch seasoning. Family liked it.
Added 1Tbsp HVRD mix as other reviewer mentioned.
Beautiful recipe, super easy for the anxious cook like myself ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Good. Used ground venison.
Simple to do & taste like homemade
Recipe was super easy. I know my family so I added 2 tablespoons of Dijon mustard to jazz it up slightly. It was great. As my wife said, who needs hamburger helper when you have this recipe.
I had made a few of the most suggested adjustments and it was absolutely awesome and so easy to make. Will definitely be making again!
Super easy! Been making this recipe for years when we need to make a quick dinner on a weeknight
I used steak and chopped it up.. doubled recipe. added a few drops of Worcestershire sauce. 2 bags of noodles.. I had mushrooms on the side for those who wanted them..
It was great but all change another can soup or half can depend I like mine well coated.

Super simple but a little bland. I used about half the amount of garlic powder and used a few cloves of fresh garlic instead of the other half. Definitely not gourmet or anything but very good in terms of price, difficulty, and speed of preparation

This is so good and simple! I added some onion, fresh mushrooms and garlic to the beef while cooking and because I didn't have sour cream I just used heavy cream. This was perfect with a bit of ground red pepper. Thank you for this recipe!
We would eat it again.
We found this a little bland. But adding some cayenne gave it some punch. Not a lot of the cayenne as a little goes a long way.
I made this for my husband, and we haven't bought hamburger helper since

I grew up on this as a kid and I still make it to this day. The reason some of you say it‚Äôs too thick, is because cream of mushroom soup is condensed. You need to add a 1/2 to 1 full can of water to it.
This is a great recipe!!!! The taste is amazing and reasonably priced. I added extra saut√©ed mushrooms. Thank you.
Really delicious I loaded it with black pepper and herbs and used plain yogurt instead of sour cream because I didn‚Äôt have any.. it‚Äôs delicious
This very quick and easy as well as tasty. I took some ideas of others and added onion, celery, peas, ranch dressing, worchestershire sauce. Would make this again.
This was good but way way to much garlic, when making it again I would put half or 1/4 of what it says. Ended up putting extra sour cream to dry and drown out the harsh garlic taste
This recipe must be wrong. 1 tablespoon of garlic powder is wayyyyyy to much. It should be 1 teaspoon.
I've been making this recipe for years. It's always a hit, it's simple, hearty and amazing.
My family really liked it, and it was super easy. To avoid dirtying another pan, I threw a can of green beans (drained) right in it. It didn‚Äôt need anything added, but I‚Äôm lazy.
Very basic but gets the job done-- whole family loved it. I added some ranch seasoning and beef broth to taste and that helped point the flavors in the right direction!

It may not be fancy, but it's just like mom used to make. Simple and yummy. Takes me back to childhood every time. So glad I get to make this for my family now, and that they enjoy it just as much as I do! Highly recommend for a quick and easy dinner.

I like this but ONLY because I added what many reviewers suggested: beef bullion with water, minced garlic, garlic salt, sherry, mushrooms, onions, then sour cream at serving. I used left-over flank steak because I happened to have it on hand.
This is an amazing recipe if you want something quick and easy to do 100% recommend
The only thing I did different was I used Campbells new Cream of Chicken/Cream of Mushrooms together in one can.
My family and i loved this recipe. This is the 2nd time i have made it. This will be a regular dinner for us. Thanks for sharing.

Absolutely delicious! I didn't have any cream of mushroom soup so I used cream of celery soup with a little milk. It felt like it was missing something but I think it was the mushroom that would've made it better. Would make again.
Good but did slighy mods of and amounts of creams.

A tablespoon of garlic powder? Seriously? I used something less than a tablespoon, had twice as much noodles, 1 1/2 lbs of ground beef and two cans of cream of mushroom soup and the garlic flavor was still over-powering. It was just barely palatable enough to eat for dinner but the leftovers will go in the garbage.

Change it to 1 teaspoon of garlic powder unless you're the type of person who likes to eat cloves of roasted garlic as an appetizer.

I'll probably make it again because it is so easy but I'll cut down the garlic to a manageable amount.
I added one diced yellow onion, one container of baby bella mushrooms (sliced), and a big splash of white wine. Super easy and quick.
I used greek yogurt, and doubled the amount to 1c. I added 1/2c of milk and much more garlic. It turned out great, and will definitely make again!

Great. 
Added my own twist by marinating the meat for a 1/2 hr in French onion dip mix with some Worchester sauce. Last, about a tsp of smoked paprika was added with the soup mix.
Great taste and easy to make, I added half cup of onions turned out good.
Didn't enjoy this at all. Way too bland!
Absolutely delicious and easy comfort food.

Was looking forward to this until adding the soup, Either you left something out of the recipe to make this where you actually can simmer with meat for 10 min. I added the amount of milk you would if using as soup. Was lacking in good flavor. Back to Chef John where I never fail. Thanks for this one for beginners though.

Pretty simple and basic recipe I‚Äôve used numerous times. Are usually add green beans and onions. Lots of black pepper. Also I do not use anything non-fat. I would believe that would make the taste very bland.I use the Progresso soup this time and a full cup of sour cream. That made it much better
Needs mushrooms and Worcestershire sauce. Add jalapenos for zing. Used GF egg noodles and Progresso GF Mushroom soup...worked great.
Followed the recipe with the exception of a touch of MSG at the end. Very delicious and extremely easy.
So easy to make and very tasty!
Really good!! I added a few splashes of Worcestershire sauce and a small can of peas!
Reminds me of when I was a kid.
I added mushrooms, diced green peppers diced onions and a package of dry ranch dressing mix
Recipe was very good. I would recommend adding saut√©ed mushrooms.
Not particularly flavorful on it's own; a mediocre dish. I'd recommend looking at the suggestions of the other reviewers to improve it.
I hate this but hubby loves it so... I made it and i tried it.. NOW I love it too.. Thanks!!
This was a quick and easy way to make delicious Beef Stroganoff.
A bit bland, but great starter recipe. Next time, I would use some beef stock or for richer flavor.
Super Easy
Like it says it's a simple recipe, it's quick (half hour) but it's pretty tastly! I added onion powder (half tablespoon) and also canned mushrooms. That was it!
It wasn't horrible but it wasn't great. It was filling but rather bland as is, will not make again.
I really liked this recipe. It was really easy to make.
This was easy and really good! My family loved this! Added a little onion, garlic, and Tony Chacheres Cajun seasoning, oh and a little milk. Excellent with Hawaiian rolls as well.
This recipe was easy and quick. My family enjoyed it. Thank you
Tasty, easy & quick...
